---
title: "Scripted Rest APIs  Part "
date: 2016-10-13T14:30:26.000Z
authors: ["Deepa Srivastava"]
link: "https://community.servicenow.com/community?id=community_blog&sys_id=80bda6a9dbd0dbc01dcaf3231f9619af"
---
<p><span style="font-family: calibri, verdana, arial, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;">This module/feature was newly introduced from Geneva release. I did a small POC to learn about it which I am going to share with you all. It has all the detailed steps for those who want to get hands on this.</span></p><p></p><p><span style="font-family: calibri, verdana, arial, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;"><strong>Use case</strong> :   We want to update few fields in our service now table with the values from some trusted source and <strong>validate</strong> them if they are in correct format before updating</span><br/><span style="font-family: calibri, verdana, arial, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;">them to the record.</span></p><p></p><p><span style="font-family: calibri, verdana, arial, sans-serif;"><strong><span>Step 1</span>:</strong> Go to 'Scripted REST APIs' module and create a new one. The API ID will be automatically populated based on the Name. Save the form. Make note of 'Base API path', we will be using it later.</span></p><p><span style="font-family: calibri, verdana, arial, sans-serif;"><img   class="image-1 jive-image" src="17f74c86dbdcd3041dcaf3231f96192e.iix" style="max-height: 900px; max-width: 1200px;"/></span></p><p></p><p><span style="font-family: calibri, verdana, arial, sans-serif;"><span><strong>Step 2:</strong></span> Next we have to create a new Resource (see related list). Provide a name, select the HTTP method this resource implements. For our case as we have to update the data,   so used</span><br/><span style="font-family: calibri, verdana, arial, sans-serif;">POST Method. Save the resource.</span></p><p><br/><span style="font-family: calibri, verdana, arial, sans-serif;"> <img   class="image-2 jive-image" src="3893efbddbd01fc068c1fb651f9619b5.iix" style="max-height: 900px; max-width: 1200px;"/></span></p><p><span style="font-family: calibri, verdana, arial, sans-serif;">----------------------------------------------------</span><br/><span style="font-family: calibri, verdana, arial, sans-serif;"> <img   class="image-3 jive-image" src="1a89cdc2db90d304b322f4621f961919.iix" style="max-height: 900px; max-width: 1200px;"/></span></p><p><span style="font-family: calibri, verdana, arial, sans-serif;"><span><strong>Step 3:</strong></span> To fetch the values from the source and validate it we have to write script in the 'Script' part in the resource. Request.body.data (RESTAPIRequestBody) object allows you to access the body content of a scripted REST API request in scripts. The highlighted part gives the response whether update was successful or not.</span></p><p><br/><span style="font-family: calibri, verdana, arial, sans-serif;"> <img   class="jive-image image-4" src="8f64a4cadb505f048c8ef4621f96198e.iix" style="max-height: 900px; max-width: 1200px;"/></span></p><p></p><p><span style="font-family: calibri, verdana, arial, sans-serif;"><strong><span>Step 4:</span> </strong> To test this I created a REST message. Create a new REST message, provide the name , endpoint as instanceurl/Base API path (this base API path we got in step1). Save the</span><br/><span style="font-family: calibri, verdana, arial, sans-serif;">form.</span></p><p></p><p><span style="font-family: calibri, verdana, arial, sans-serif;"><strong><span>Step 5:</span></strong> HTTP methods (GET,POST,PUT,PATCH)   will appear at the bottom. Open the POST and configure as below.</span><br/><span style="font-family: calibri, verdana, arial, sans-serif;"> <img   class="image-5 jive-image" src="d6b38c46db181304b322f4621f9619d5.iix" style="max-height: 900px; max-width: 1200px;"/></span></p><p><br/><span style="font-family: calibri, verdana, arial, sans-serif;"> <img   class="image-6 jive-image" src="b1d5a3f5dbd41704ed6af3231f9619e1.iix" style="max-height: 900px; max-width: 1200px;"/></span></p><p></p><p><span style="font-family: calibri, verdana, arial, sans-serif;"><span><strong>Step 6:</strong></span> Goto the HTTP Request tab and Enter the data to be tested in the 'Content' field. Various request and response format are supported for this like JSON,XML,test/XML.   I used JSON format for request and response.   We need some unique field (as INC number) so as to identify the record to be updated.</span></p><p><span style="font-family: calibri, verdana, arial, sans-serif;"><img   class="image-7 jive-image" src="d0840186db141b04ed6af3231f9619ca.iix" style="max-height: 900px; max-width: 1200px;"/></span></p><p></p><p><span style="font-family: calibri, verdana, arial, sans-serif;"><span><strong>Step7:</strong></span> Now time to Test the connection (click test as shown in above screenshot).</span></p><p><br/><span style="font-family: calibri, verdana, arial, sans-serif;"> <img class="jive-image image-8" src="data:image/png;base64," style="max-height: 900px; max-width: 1200px;"/></span></p><p><span style="font-family: calibri, verdana, arial, sans-serif;"><img   class="image-9 jive-image" src="7875680adb905f048c8ef4621f961937.iix" style="max-height: 900px; max-width: 1200px;"/></span></p><p></p><p></p><p><span style="font-family: calibri, verdana, arial, sans-serif;">You can see the HTTP status as 200 which means that connection was successful. But as I provided the year in wrong format I got the customized <strong>response</strong> which I gave in the script.</span></p><p><span style="font-family: calibri, verdana, arial, sans-serif;">We may get different HTTP status if there is some or the other connection errors. Check below link for more details.</span></p><p></p><p><span style="font-family: calibri, verdana, arial, sans-serif;"><a title="ocs.servicenow.com/bundle/helsinki-servicenow-platform/page/integrate/inbound-rest/reference/r_RESTAPIHTTPResponseCodes.html" href="https://docs.servicenow.com/bundle/helsinki-servicenow-platform/page/integrate/inbound-rest/reference/r_RESTAPIHTTPResponseCodes.html">https://docs.servicenow.com/bundle/helsinki-servicenow-platform/page/integrate/inbound-rest/reference/r_RESTAPIHTTPResponseCodes.html</a></span></p><p><span style="font-family: calibri, verdana, arial, sans-serif;"><a title="ocs.servicenow.com/bundle/helsinki-servicenow-platform/page/integrate/custom-web-services/concept/c_CustomWebServiceAccessControls.html" href="https://docs.servicenow.com/bundle/helsinki-servicenow-platform/page/integrate/custom-web-services/concept/c_CustomWebServiceAccessControls.html">https://docs.servicenow.com/bundle/helsinki-servicenow-platform/page/integrate/custom-web-services/concept/c_CustomWebServiceAccessControls.html</a></span></p><p></p><p><span style="font-family: calibri, verdana, arial, sans-serif;">If you want resource to require authentication and not be public, check 'Require Authentication' in the resource. Then in the REST message in the 'Authentication' Tab select the 'Authentication type' as basic. Create a new Basic Auth Profile with some Name, username and password of a user from User(sys_user) table.</span></p><p><span style="font-family: calibri, verdana, arial, sans-serif;"><img   class="jive-image image-10" src="a7440c06db58db048c8ef4621f96199d.iix" style="max-height: 900px; max-width: 1200px;"/></span></p><p><span style="font-family: calibri, verdana, arial, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;">I hope this blog will help you to give an idea about Scripted REST APIs. There are still many areas in this which needs to be explored. I will write once I have them explored.</span></p><p><span style="font-family: calibri, verdana, arial, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;">Will be coming up with GET example on this soon...</span></p><p><a title="Developer Community" __default_attr="2009" __jive_macro_name="community" class="jive_macro_community jive_macro" data-orig-content="Developer Community" data-renderedposition="3750.449951171875_8_158_16" href="undefined2009">Developer Community</a></p><p><span style="font-size: 12pt;"><span style="font-family: calibri, verdana, arial, sans-serif;">Please encourage me to write more by hitting on like/share/bookmark (on the top right corner) </span><span __jive_emoticon_name="happy" __jive_macro_name="emoticon" class="jive_emote jive_macro" data-renderedposition="3770.4599609375_631.4500122070312_16_16" src="/8.0.4.21bdc7e/images/emoticons/happy.png"></span></span></p>
